intro: Euphorbia splendens var. bojeri, commonly known as the Bojer’s Natal waxplant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It features dense clusters of fleshy, triangular stems that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in late winter to early spring, which are surrounded by colorful bracts. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and indoor spaces.
